column4: I'm logged into my webmin on my server and I can see that /usr/sbin/apache2 -k start is running like 10 times
shouldnt that be based on the apache config?
it's running as root and as www-data
i haven't looked at it earlier, just saw it now
having > 1 apache process is rteally nothing special
play with your apache config and tweak it to your needs
the default values are just .....'default values' matching for some .. not for others
llutz_: okay.. so I shouldn't mind apache running as root? the website is not live, I access it only via ssh tunnel
ive looked after the conf in several places now, haven't found the parameter your stating llutz_ .. checked /etc/default/apache2 and /etc/phpmyadmin/apache.conf
i do see 1 root process here - and several owned by www-data
the first is wondering me myself a bit - the second is rhe expected part
then we are on the same page.. I have the same setup as you. I don't know how that happend.
I didn't know that! I probarbly should remove webmin then, I've always used it.
having 1 apache process owned by root isnt that special either btw
I reckoned from your statement earlier, I felt more calm.
so - basically seeing > 1 process owned by www-data or similar users -> is fine - if you want less - consider checking your apache config for min/max etc
